Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery band-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: lip black; in handle zone part of figure or animal with added white outline and added red patch.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.137.21. Heesen suggests that the scene might represent fighting cocks.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 407, no. B615)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0499) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
